subject: Golf
Halls of Fame
lead_paragraph: Lorena Ochoa qualified for the L.P.G.A. Tour Hall of Fame on Sunday, winning the Corona Championship in Morelia, Mexico, by 11 strokes for her third straight victory and fourth in five starts this year. Ochoa, 26, became the second-youngest player to qualify for the Hall of Fame, although she still must be a tour member for 10 years — in her case, until 2012 — to be eligible for induction.
